DataElement.preferredName: Prior Maintenance Therapy Greater Than or Equal To Two Or BCG Regimen Induction Second Dose Administered Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to the administered prior maintenance therapy greater than or equal to two or BCG regimen induction of second dose.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Maintenance Therapy Greater Than or Equal To Two Or BCG Regimen Induction Second Dose Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._Continuation of treatment for an extended period of time to prevent relapse._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways._A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._An immunotherapy regimen consisting of Bacillus Calmette-Guerin (BCG) that may be used in the treatment of bladder cancer._The act of bringing about something._Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Continuation of treatment for an extended period of time to prevent relapse.

Concepts.definition: Continuation of treatment for an extended period of time to prevent relapse.

Property.preferredName: Greater Than or Equal To Two Or BCG Regimen Induction Second Dose Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.:A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:An immunotherapy regimen consisting of Bacillus Calmette-Guerin (BCG) that may be used in the treatment of bladder cancer.:The act of bringing about something.:Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.:A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
An immunotherapy regimen consisting of Bacillus Calmette-Guerin (BCG) that may be used in the treatment of bladder cancer.
The act of bringing about something.
Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
